Key Arguments: Censorship is not an effective solution to misinformation and can have dangerous consequences.
Silencing voices can lead to further division and increase the spread of misinformation.
Efforts to combat misinformation should avoid being influenced by conflicts of interest.
An informed and empowered population is a better solution to misinformation.
Past government actions during the pandemic involved suppressing truthful information under the guise of combating misinformation.
Main Themes: Government overreach and misuse of power
Conflicts of interest in information control
Notable Quotes: Censorship is not the answer. It can also backfire dangerously.
The solution is to encourage an active and well-informed population, empowered to think.
The onerous task of keeping a population calm during the pandemic, led to our Department of Home Affairs employing tactics to suppress truthful information.
